show.title: Barb & Star Go to Vista del Mar
show.headline: The friendship we all want. The vacation we all need.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: BARB AND STAR GO TO VISTA DEL MAR

posterImages.altText: BARB AND STAR GO TO VISTA DEL MAR

event.title: <show-title>Barb & Star Go to Vista del Mar</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Head to Palm Vista for an interactive screening with props & official couples
event.description:
Cancel this month’s Talking Club, because the seagulls in the sand have heard our prayers and our BARB & STAR GO TO VISTA DEL MAR movie party is back!

Co-written and co-starring Kristen Wiig and Annie Mumulo, it’s the instant cult comedy classic tale of two Soft Rock, Nebraska, natives on an epic, soul-douching adventure in a little Florida oasis called Vista Del Mar. When these two frisky mid-lifers arrive, they find that Vista Del Mar has more than just a 24-hour CVS and Tommy Bahama-clad hunks, it’s filled with lethal mosquitos, human cannons, water spirits, banana boats, and one very reluctantly crowned Shrimp Queen.

At the BARB & STAR Movie Party, there’ll be dancing, there’ll be singing, and there’ll be a whole lot of being who you are. We’ll also have special Vista Del Mar visors, leis, and other party favors there waiting for you.

So get excited! Whip out your seashell phone, call Trish (who trusts), and pick out your favorite pair of parachute culottes for our interactive celebration of our favorite besties of 2021, Barb and Star.

posterImage.altText: Barb Star MP Web SHOW P 960x1400

eventType.title: Movie Party
eventType.headline: Celebrate your fave movies with fun, interactive props, themed drinks, and more
eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: Clueless
show.headline: The essential ‘90s teen comedy

event.title: <show-title>Clueless</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Make a cameo at this interactive party
event.description:
Before reinventing Jane Austen became cliché, Amy Heckerling adapted the classic story of Emma into a hilarious, insanely clever satire of adolescence in Beverly Hills. CLUELESS spawned fashion trends, countless slang terms (AS IF!), and gave Alicia Silverstone a reason to exist beyond Aerosmith videos. Over 20 years later(!), we are still majorly, totally, butt-crazy in love with this movie.

At this special interactive screening, we'll roll with the homies and say all of our favorite lines together, plus we'll have props to help us pretend that, for one glorious night, we're the Class of '95 at Bronson Alcott High School.

We'll play matchmaker for sweet old teachers, make a cameo at the Val party, and thank an LA city bus driver for taking a chance on an unknown kid. So slip on your Calvin Klein dress – or come dressed as any of your favorite characters (the more Dionnes, the better!) – and make time in your busy pants-dropping schedule to attend.

event.title: <event-type-title>Advance Screening:</event-type-title> <show-title>Evil Dead Rise</show-title>
event.headline: A gory sneak peek of the latest EVIL DEAD chapter presented by Fantastic Fest
event.description: It’s time to open the book for an exclusive advance screening of writer/director Lee Cronin’s EVIL DEAD RISE, presented by Fantastic Fest. Executive produced by Sam Raimi and Bruce Campbell, the latest chapter of the EVIL DEAD saga brings the blood, gore, and humor you know and love while summoning a few new horrors along with it. Reserve your seat and you’ll be automatically entered for a chance to win one FAN badge to attend Fantastic Fest 2023.

show.title: Chop & Steele
show.headline: A comedy doc featuring childhood friends turned professional comedians

event.title: <show-title>Chop & Steele</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: The Found Footage Festival take their brand of comic mischief to the next level
event.description:
“A very funny and entertaining documentary about friendship, the art of comedy, and the skill and creativity it takes to execute the perfect practical joke – even if it lands you in serious legal trouble.” - Louisa Moore, Screen Zealots

When childhood friends Nick Prueher and Joe Pickett start booking their gag strongman routine on unsuspecting morning news shows, their pranks end up going viral, landing them in federal court with a vengeful media conglomerate.

All screenings will be followed by a Found Footage Festival performance by Nick and Joe with live Q&A. CHOP & STEELE is part of a double feature with A LIFE ON THE FARM, a documentary about the weirdest VHS tape Joe and Nick have ever seen. The film will feature a live intro and Q&A. Separate tickets are required for each film.

eventType.title: Live Q&A
eventType.headline: Exclusive conversations with actors and filmmakers
eventType.description: Got a question for the director? Wanna meet the cast? At our special Live Q&A events, we follow the screening with an in-person discussion.

show.title: Tetsuo: The Iron Man
show.headline: Shinya Tsukamoto’s unhinged body horror manifesto.

event.title: <show-title>Tetsuo: The Iron Man</show-title>
event.headline: Shinya Tsukamoto’s unhinged tech-body horror mind-warper
event.description:
Welcome to filmmaker Shinya Tsukamoto’s unhinged hot take on humankind’s ongoing battle with technology; literally, as a man mutates into a walking man-machine that terrorizes himself and everyone around him. Warping elements of early Cronenberg, Lynch, and Raimi into a cyberpunk cocktail, TETSUO is a body horror manifesto that’s fueled by techno-erotic adrenaline and wrought iron perversion. Virtually absent from theater screens since the 1990s, this underground classic from Japan has been newly restored.

Restoration courtesy of Arrow Films and the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: Subspecies V: Blood Rise
show.headline: The theatrical premiere of Full Moon Features' latest

event.title: <show-title>Subspecies V: Blood Rise</show-title>
event.headline: The theatrical premiere of Full Moon Features' latest
event.description:
The special Graveyard Shift presentation includes an exclusive introduction and pre-recorded post-screening Q&A with members of the cast and director, Ted Nicolaou.

SUBSPECIES V: BLOODRISE follows the descent of Radu (once more played by series regular Anders Hove) from a noble warrior of the church to a depraved, blood-hungry creature of the night. Stolen by crusaders on the night of his birth from his demon mother and vampire father, Radu grows up with no knowledge of his monstrous bloodline. Trained and exploited by a brotherhood of mystic monks to slay all enemies of the church, fate brings him back one night to his father's castle, armed with the monster-slaying Sword of Laertes, to destroy the vampire Vladislas and reclaim a holy relic, the Bloodstone.

Filmed in Serbia in and around historical castles and ruins, and co-starring original series star Denice Duff in a surprising role, this sensual, violent, and operatic exploration of evil marks a stunning return for one of the screen's most beloved monsters.

SUBSPECIES V: BLOODRISE is directed by series mainstay Ted Nicolaou (TERRORVISION), making SUBSPECIES one of the only horror franchises in which every entry is helmed by the same director.

show.title: The Devil's Backbone
show.headline: A gripping ghost yarn as only Guillermo del Toro could tell it

event.title: <show-title>The Devil's Backbone</show-title>
event.headline: A gripping ghost yarn as only Guillermo del Toro could tell it
event.description:
Set during the Spanish Civil War, Guillermo del Toro's haunting ghost story follows a 12-year-old boy left at a rural orphanage after the death of his freedom-fighter father. As frightening as it is personal, del Toro's movie masterfully weaves together gothic-inspired scares, a deeply disturbing mystery, and historical melodrama to explore the horrors waiting for us both on and off the mortal coil. THE DEVIL'S BACKBONE serves as a companion piece to del Toro's Oscar-winning PAN'S LABYRINTH. Don't miss a new 4K restoration of this bone-chilling classic.

Presented in Spanish with English subtitles

show.title: Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday
show.headline: A symphony of body horror chaos

landscapeHeroImage.altText: JASON GOES TO HELL: THE FINAL FRIDAY

portraitHeroImage.altText: JASON GOES TO HELL: THE FINAL FRIDAY

posterImages.altText: JASON GOES TO HELL: THE FINAL FRIDAY

event.title: <show-title>Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday</show-title>
event.headline: A symphony of body horror chaos
event.description:
This is the FRIDAY THE 13TH movie that no one loves, but everyone should. Unleashed from the psyche of then-23-year-old director Adam Marcus, JASON GOES TO HELL lights the expected slasher template on fire and replaces it with a symphony of coked-out, body horror chaos. This ninth chapter in the franchise finds the possessed soul of Jason Voorhees hopping from body to body – just like THE HIDDEN – while a bounty hunter named Creighton Duke (the scene-stealing Steven Williams) attempts to destroy him. JASON GOES TO HELL is a goop-filled cyclone that delivers mega-fun to anyone who gets within five feet of its radiant power.

Screening the theatrical cut from an archival 35mm print

show.title: Pulse (2001)
show.headline: The original Japanese cult classic

event.title: <show-title>Pulse (2001)</show-title>
event.headline: The original Japanese cult classic.
event.description: Before THE GRUDGE, before DARK WATER, there was PULSE, one of the scariest films ever made by the master of Japanese horror, Kiyoshi Kurosawa. A group of young friends is rocked by the sudden suicide of one of their own. When his ghostly image appears on their computer screens, something far more horrifying is unleashed. The terror mounts as more deaths and disappearances occur. Kurosawa’s PULSE is a psychologically unsettling tale, which effects will endure long after the chills have subsided.

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Silent Hill
show.headline: The haunting video game adaptation.

event.title: <show-title>Silent Hill</show-title>
event.headline: The haunting video game adaptation.
event.description:
An ambitious live-action adaptation of the video game series, SILENT HILL finds Rosa (Radha Mitchell) and her missing daughter navigating a mysterious alternate dimension that’s filled with jaw-dropping monsters, bizarre puzzles, and vengeful witches. Unlike most American horror movies from the 2000s, SILENT HILL isn’t concerned with nu metal riffage or SAW-styled torture scenes. Instead, the movie combines the folk-tinged creeps of Japanese horror films with an elegant approach to design. The result is a haunting, psychedelic experience that feels like being trapped in a waking nightmare.

Screening an archival 35mm print.

show.title: The Blob (1988)
show.headline: Bigger, better, and BLOBBIER.

event.title: <show-title>The Blob (1988)</show-title>
event.headline: Bigger, better, and blobbier.
event.description:
Helmed by the team behind A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 3: DREAM WARRIORS, THE BLOB joins John Carpenter’s THE THING and David Cronenberg’s THE FLY as one of the most electrifying horror remakes of the 1980s. The movie mixes YA vibes with Stephen King-styled government conspiracy theories to provide a foundation for what we’re all here to see—breathtaking special effects featuring the neon-tinged, human-ingestion machine known as the Blob.

Screening the 4K restoration.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Descent
show.headline: An essential benchmark of 21st century horror

event.title: <show-title>The Descent</show-title>
event.headline: A benchmark of 21st century horror
event.description:
Just when you thought it was safe to go cave spelunking, you hit THE DESCENT. After a tragic car accident, emotionally wounded Sarah (Shauna MacDonald) joins five friends on a cave expedition in the Appalachian Mountains. But questionable decisions leave the group trapped underground and alone . . . except for the subhumanoid slime-monsters. THE DESCENT feels like what would happen if Stanley Kubrick directed THE TEXAS CHAIN SAW MASSACRE in a cave with an amazing ensemble cast of women. Writer-director Neil Marshall (DOG SOLDIERS) delivers high tension and goopy violence over a foundation of empathy, friendship and survival.

Screening the theatrical cut from an archival 35mm print.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The People Under the Stairs
show.headline: Wes Craven’s unsung classic

portraitHeroImage.altText: People under the stairs sp portrait

posterImages.altText: Showpage Poster People Under The Stairs

event.title: <show-title>The People Under the Stairs</show-title>
event.headline: Wes Craven's unsung classic
event.description: With LAST HOUSE ON THE LEFT, A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET, and SCREAM, the late Wes Craven revolutionized the horror genre on three separate occasions over three separate decades. But with THE PEOPLE UNDER THE STAIRS, Craven unleashed the most forward-thinking work of his career – a horror movie about the horrors of classism. Featuring incredible performances from Wendy Robie and Everett McGill (aka Ed and Nadine from Twin Peaks) and Ving Rhames (PULP FICTION), this nerve-shredding masterwork explodes with vicious violence, sick humor, and a heroic scene of a kid punching a rich scumbag in the crotch.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (1974)
show.headline: Get revved up for a 4K restoration of the nerve-shredding horror classic

event.title: <show-title>The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (1974)</show-title>
event.headline: Tobe Hooper’s ferocious classic
event.description:
Nothing will ever diminish the power of this movie. Shot through a cinéma vérité lens, THE TEXAS CHAIN SAW MASSACRE follows five friends that fall victim to the grotesque Leatherface and his cannibalistic family. With a beautifully raw DIY aesthetic and powerful performances, this shockingly realistic film revolutionized the horror landscape when it was unleashed on a politically and socially tumultuous America in 1974. Facing controversy and censorship throughout its troubled release, TEXAS CHAIN SAW has stood the test of time to become a landmark film and cultural milestone.

Screening the 4K restoration.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Freeway
show.headline: Reese Witherspoon is no little red riding hood.

event.title: <show-title>Freeway</show-title>
event.headline: Reese Witherspoon is no little red riding hood
event.description:
"Rude in the way the truth is rude – only funnier. The movie seduces with its humor, all the while presenting a realized vision of a harsh, absurd world." – Mick LaSalle, San Francisco Chronicle

Reese Witherspoon as potty-mouthed white trash Vanessa Lutz is among her most underrated roles. In this modern take on Little Red Riding Hood, Kiefer Sutherland plays the not-subtly named Bob Wolverton, a serial killer who meets his match in Vanessa, a 15-year-old on her way to her grandmother’s after her parents are both arrested. Bob picks her up hitchhiking, gains her trust, and then reveals himself – but Vanessa is sharp and quick, shooting him and leaving him for dead. Trouble is, he doesn’t die, and instead, she finds herself on trial. Can this bad-behaving juvenile delinquent win against a well-respected school counselor? You better believe she won’t go down without a fight! Written and directed by Matthew Bright (best known as the screenwriter for FORBIDDEN ZONE), FREEWAY is impressive and often hilarious with a great supporting cast including Brooke Shields, Amanda Plummer, and Dan Hedaya. (Cristina Cacciopo)

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
WHERE WOLF - a new creator-owned graphic novel from creative team Rob Saucedo, Debora Lancianese and Jack Morelli - is set in the wild world of furry conventions, small-town Texas journalism and werewolf whodunit.

Leading up to the wide release of the book, writer and Alamo Drafthouse programmer Rob Saucedo will tour movie theaters across the country - screening werewolf and werewolf-adjacent films and providing an opportunity to purchase the graphic novel early at concurrent signing events.

"Rude in the way the truth is rude – only funnier. The movie seduces with its humor, all the while presenting a realized vision of a harsh, absurd world." – Mick LaSalle, San Francisco Chronicle

Reese Witherspoon as potty-mouthed white trash Vanessa Lutz is among her most underrated roles. In this modern take on Little Red Riding Hood, Kiefer Sutherland plays the not-subtly named Bob Wolverton, a serial killer who meets his match in Vanessa, a 15-year-old on her way to her grandmother’s after her parents are both arrested. Bob picks her up hitchhiking, gains her trust, and then reveals himself – but Vanessa is sharp and quick, shooting him and leaving him for dead. Trouble is, he doesn’t die, and instead, she finds herself on trial. Can this bad-behaving juvenile delinquent win against a well-respected school counselor? You better believe she won’t go down without a fight! Written and directed by Matthew Bright (best known as the screenwriter for FORBIDDEN ZONE), FREEWAY is impressive and often hilarious with a great supporting cast including Brooke Shields, Amanda Plummer, and Dan Hedaya. (Cristina Cacciopo)

show.title: Happiness of the Katakuris
show.headline: A fairly typical murder musical about family

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Ww happiness of the katakuris hero

portraitHeroImage.altText: Happiness of the katakuris sp portrait

posterImages.altText: Ww happiness of the katakuris poster

event.title: <show-title>Happiness of the Katakuris</show-title>
event.headline: A fairly typical murder musical about family
event.description:
Prolific Japanese director Takashi Miike has done everything from traditional samurai dramas to superhero movies. He may make one movie about the yakuza and another about vampires or a third about both. He's totally wild and unpredictable which makes HAPPINESS OF THE KATAKURIS the perfect playground for his imagination. It's a musical, it's a family drama, it's a murder mystery, it's a comedy. There's animation, surreal dance numbers, and zombies. A brief summary could indicate that it's about a family attempting to run a bed and breakfast in the Japanese countryside despite a high mortality rate among their guests, but that doesn't quite communicate how ridiculous and fun it is to watch the chaos unfold. Strangest of all, buried between the claymation monstrosities and undead sumo wrestlers is a sweet and tender center: the Katakuri family!

Restoration courtesy of Arrow Video and the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: Perdita Durango (Dance with the Devil)
show.headline: Two frantic, ferocious, and free criminals on a dark road to cheap thrills

event.title: <show-title>Perdita Durango (Dance with the Devil)</show-title>
event.headline: A dark road to cheap thrills, from the writer of WILD AT HEART.
event.description:
NYC: Hosted by Heather Buckley (Black Mansion Films)

Unpredictable and quite special, this off-the-chain semi-sequel to WILD AT HEART stars Rosie Perez, Javier Bardem, and James Gandolfini in the wildest movie of any of their respective careers. Directed by Spanish provocateur Alex de la Iglesia (DAY OF THE BEAST, ACCION MUTANTE), PERDITA’s nightmare splatter universe lingers in your imagination in an equal but different way than Lynch’s signature style.

Here, Perez reimagines Isabella Rossellini’s melancholic character into a tightly-coiled woman on the edge – one in love with an even crazier Bardem, who’s casually into blood rituals, bank/graverobbing, extortion, and wholesale slaughter. Gandolfini is just awesome as the bumbling FBI agent on their trail. This thing rocks.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Heroic Trio
show.headline: Lady-powered kung fu wizardry from beyond the universe

event.title: <show-title>The Heroic Trio</show-title>
event.headline: Michelle Yeoh, Maggie Cheung, and Anita Mui superhero bonanza!
event.description:
Hosted by Hyperreal Film Club

Celebrating its 30th anniversary in 2023, THE HEROIC TRIO deserves a damn victory lap. Playing like a greatest hits of Hong Kong action’s funnest tricks, this maximalist joyride is all gas no brakes.

Johnnie To’s Hong Kong is a gothic, brutalist playscape occupied by wires and fog. Masters of the flying guillotine co-exist with desktop computers. Tex Avery writes the laws of physics. It’s always a little windy, even indoors.

An ancient evil lurks beneath the city streets...a baby-snatching baddie for whom police and professors are no match. Enter Maggie Cheung (Thief Catcher), Michelle Yeoh (Invisible Girl), and the late Anita Mui (Wonder Woman)...conflicted vigilantes and three of the baddest to ever do it.

Stuffed to the gills with on-the-nose allusions and potent visual motifs, THE HEROIC TRIO is a practical effects extravaganza with wild fits, at least two of your kinks, and a melodic theme that will live in your head rent-free. (Hyperreal Film Club)

About Hyperreal:
Hyperreal Film Club is Cinema for the People.

show.title: Truck Turner
show.headline: Isaac Hayes barrels through the criminal underworld with a vengeance.

event.title: <show-title>Truck Turner</show-title>
event.headline: Isaac Hayes barrels through the criminal underworld with a vengeance.
event.description:
If there’s a better blaxploitation movie than TRUCK TURNER we haven’t found it - and we’ve looked! Isaac Hayes turns on the charm as a legendary bounty hunter with a short temper. When he takes down a psychopathic pimp named Gator, he inadvertantly creates a power vacuum in the Los Angeles prostitution scene. Then Gator’s bottom woman Nichelle (“Lt. Uhura”) Nichols (who should have gotten the Oscar, seriously) offers Gator’s orphaned whores to any mack who can take down Truck Turner. Soon there’s an open war in the streets between the wisecracking, beer-guzzling Turner and a coalition of over the top pimps, the most dangerous being Yaphet Kotto’s intense Harvard Blue. Every line of dialogue in this movie is suitable for framing, with the most creative use of profanity in movie history. To top it off, there’s an Isaac Hayes score and Scatman Crothers as an elderly, but still active, pimp. It just can’t get better than this. It can’t! (Lars Nilsen, Warped & Faded: Weird Wednesday and the Birth of the American Genre Film Archive)

35mm print courtesy of Park Circus.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Wild Things
show.headline: An erotic thriller with more twists than a pretzel!

event.title: <show-title>Wild Things</show-title>
event.headline: An erotic thriller with more twists than a pretzel!
event.description:
SCREAM queen Neve Campbell looking to further distance herself from any good girl vibes lingering from her "Party of Five" days waded further into the swamp of genre sleaze in 1998's totally unhinged erotic thriller WILD THINGS. Joining her is sultry 90s bad girl Denise Richards and a couple of hunks by the names of Matt Dillon and Kevin Bacon. Dillon is the unbelievably hot high shcool teacher with whom Richards seems to have a fixation. Campbell is the weirdo swamprat with multiple suspensions on her permanent record. When Richards accuses Dillon of rape, Kevin Bacon is assigned to investigate the case. How these four lives get further entangled is the joy of watching WILD THINGS, its plotting so full of twists, turns, fake-outs, and double crosses that it's more like riding a roller coaster than watching a movie. Need a cherry on top? Bill Murray plays an ambulance-chasing trial lawyer.

Content warning: contains verbal descriptions of sexual assault.

35mm print courtesy of Sony Pictures Repertory.

show.title: Legally Blonde
show.headline: Time to brush up on your legal jargon

event.title: <show-title>Legally Blonde</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A party for the Gemini vegetarian in all of us
event.description: Start practicing your bend and snap, because we’re putting on an interactive screening of the bubbliest of films with the bubbliest of drinks – the LEGALLY BLONDE Champagne Cinema Movie Party! Go blonde and join us for a celebration of the 2001 comedy starring Reese Witherspoon with fun props, champagne available for order, and plenty of Luke Wilson looking dreamy. When you arrive, we'll provide you with nail stickers that any Gemini vegetarian would be honored to wear, a manicure kit to keep everything up to Harvard standards, and a fuzzy pen, because what else are you going to take notes with in class?!

show.title: Tammy and the T-Rex
show.headline: The unholy mash-up of Beverly Hills 90210 and JURASSIC PARK, fully restored

posterImages.altText: Sf tammy and the trex poster

event.title: <show-title>Tammy and the T-Rex</show-title>
event.headline: The unholy mash-up of Beverly Hills 90210 and JURASSIC PARK, fully restored
event.description:
Directed by Stewart Raffill (MAC AND ME, THE ICE PIRATES), TAMMY AND THE T-REX is a love story as old as time.

This post-JURASSIC jam stars Denise Richards (STARSHIP TROOPERS, WILD THINGS) and the late Paul Walker (THE FAST AND THE FURIOUS) in an unprecedented mishmash of rom-com tropes and R-rated horror thrills. When Paul's mauled by the local zoo’s toothier residents, his love affair with Denise doesn’t cease — even after his brain is transplanted into an ancient animatronic predator. Oh, and did we mention “Bernie” from WEEKEND AT BERNIE’S is the villain?

Originally filmed as a gorefest w/ impressive splatter by SFX guru John Carl Buechler, TAMMY’s only minimal release back in the day was cut to PG-13, funneled straight-to-video and inexplicably marketed as a “kids’ film.” Thanks to the intrepid efforts of top-notch archival pals Vinegar Syndrome, this gonzo gem is fully restored and ready to scorch your audience's ganglia into dust! (American Genre Film Archive)

Restoration courtesy of Vinegar Syndrome and the American Genre Film Archive.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Silver Bullet
show.headline: When darkness falls, terror rises.

event.title: <show-title>Silver Bullet</show-title>
event.headline: Don't miss this werewolf classic, screening along with a graphic novel signing
event.description:
WHERE WOLF - a new creator-owned graphic novel from creative team Rob Saucedo, Debora Lancianese and Jack Morelli - is set in the wild world of furry conventions, small-town Texas journalism and werewolf whodunit.

Leading up to the wide release of the book, writer and Graveyard Shift programmer Rob Saucedo will tour movie theaters across the country - screening werewolf films and providing an opportunity to purchase the graphic novel early at concurrent signing events.

In WHERE WOLF, something scary stalks the streets of Texas, leaving a trail of corpses in its wake. The only person standing in its way is Larry Chaney, a slacker reporter who can’t hold a job, can’t keep a girlfriend, and can’t stop getting in the way of his own career. Larry must go undercover at a local furry convention if he has any hope of stopping the beast dead set on turning the gathered attendees into an all-you-can-eat buffet. The graphic novel is a love letter to werewolf fans, with an irreverent bent that takes decades of lycanthropic lore to new heights and surprising places.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
